summary: Weight
title: Weight
body:
Day 3 of May, Myself and I.

So I forgot to post this before I left for a colleagues b.day drinks tonight so I’m posting it too many drinks in on my phone… oops.

Sorry.


Enjoy!

____

Everything was white.

He’d been stuck in the darkness for so long that the sudden brightness was blinding.

Blinking someone slowly came into focus in front of him, reminding him of when Carol Danvers had appeared outside the ship when hope was almost lost.

Except this time it wasn’t Carol. It was Natasha.

All at once his memories came back to him. The final battle, him stealing the stones of Thanos and then… snap.

He can’t stop the tears that fall down his cheeks and he remembers. Remembers Peter telling him that they’d won, the poor boy’s heart breaking as he lost yet another parent. Remembers Pepper, telling him that it was okay, he could rest. God he was lucky so have had them.

Then he thinks of Morgan, his little Mauguna, and he breaks under what feels like the weight of the universe falling on top him. His baby girl would have to grow up without him and as much as Pepper told him it’s okay it’s really not. Natasha is there to catch him and holds him as the sobs wrack his body.

Once he is somewhat cried out Natasha stands and pulls him up with her, silently leading him and without warning they are standing outside his house. He watches Pepper push his 1st ark reactor out into the lake and takes in the group of people that surround her.

“They’re all here for you Tony,” Natasha tells him, gently squeezing his hand. “I know right now the weight of loss is crushing you but you did it, you saved them. Because of you they get to wake up tomorrow in a world made safe.”

“No,” he whispers, watching as his family say goodbye, “Because of us.”

summary: Tony: Not a fan of when people have big news and ask if I'm sitting down. Don't try and mitigate my relationship with the floor,...
body: Tony: Not a fan of when people have big news and ask if I'm sitting down. Don't try and mitigate my relationship with the floor, if I want to dramatically collapse, I'll collapse, don't force me into a squandered lean.

blog.name: peter-parker--tony-stark
blog.title: peter-parker--tony-stark
blog.description:
Tony Stark and his adopted son
My random thoughts on anything mcu

summary: Endgame Spoilers
body:
Endgame Spoilers

Peter standing by his locker, waiting for Ned, and with his senses dialed to 11, overhearing a conversation about the avengers.

Someone mentions Tony and a wave of emotion comes over him. And then he hears ‘yeah well, I’m glad it was tony who died and not one of the others because I never really liked tony’

Peter, fuming with anger, running up to the kid who said that and screaming at him about how amazing tony was and that tony saved the world by sacrificing his own life.

Peter, in tears, running into the bathroom, breathing hard and just falling onto his knees because Mr Stark, the most caring person he ever knew, was gone and there was nothing that he could do about it

blog.name: saltistoosalty
blog.title: Saltistoosalty
blog.description: INTJ | Fangirl | Christian | Author (aspiring) | Artist (Occasionally) | What my blog will mostly be about the next few weeks: Spider-Man

summary: Okay but Peter being sad over Tony is something I was so scared they wouldn’t do in FFH. Also, Peter being a mini-Tony is both...
body:
Okay but Peter being sad over Tony is something I was so scared they wouldn’t do in FFH. Also, Peter being a mini-Tony is both awesome and devastating when you realise it’s like he’s trying to make up for it or something.

“The world need the next Iron Man” I think Peter thinks that’s his future but I hope at least part of his arc in this movie is that Peter realised that he’s Spider-Man and nobody else.

Seems like Tony will be a major part of this movie even indirectly.

summary:
Title: The Prince's Bride
 Rating: T Pairing: Tony x Bucky Warnings: Canon typical violence, fake character death
 Notes: A fill...
body:
Title: The Prince’s Bride
Rating: T
Pairing: Tony x Bucky
Warnings: Canon typical violence, fake character death
Notes: A fill for @marveltrumpshate ! And massive thanks to @summerpipedream for beta’ing the fic, which was their fill for me ;) 

Summary: After Tony loses the love of his life to pirates on the high sea, not much matters to him. He agrees to wed Prince Justin Hammer to gain access to vibranium and shut himself away in his workshop until the end of time, but a group of ruffians kidnap Tony to take him to Hydra.

Tony’s rescue takes on an unlikely form - the Dread Pirate Rogers, who killed the love of his life five years ago.

A Princess Bride AU 

Link: https://archiveofourown.org/works/18736378/chapters/44442631

summary: with the reveal of the new far from home trailer, we obviously see a little place of mourning for iron man as well as some...
body:
with the reveal of the new far from home trailer, we obviously see a little place of mourning for iron man as well as some graffiti on the side of a building but i swear to G O D there better be more i better see whole fucking memorials the size of skyscrapers dedicated to tony fucking stark and everything he did to save everyone if we don’t get to actually FEEL how much he is truly missed i’m gonna lose my shit

i better see a grateful universe

blog.name: awesometheydontknowiamhere
blog.title: The Aesthetic Alien
blog.description: Occasional writer.Poetry on bad days. Fanfiction on good ones. Taurus. Multifandom. Like way too many fandoms to be considered healthy or sane.This blog is a safe space for everyone. Reach out if you need a friend.

summary:
Ugh I hate to be that person but today was especially tough. I've lost count of the number of times I cried. 
This one time in...
body:
Ugh I hate to be that person but today was especially tough. I’ve lost count of the number of times I cried.

This one time in school I locked myself in a bathroom stall and pressed my hand over my mouth to not make any noise.

This trailer fucked me up, utterly and completely.

I don’t want to be this sobbing mess, but my heart legitimately hearts so much.

I couldn’t even finish typing this post without getting sobby.

tags: yes i'm already on this bullshit
how else am i supposed to see tony with peter again
summary: Maybe in Another World
title: Maybe in Another World
body:
Summary: Peter reunites with a multiverse Tony

Pairing: Tony & Peter, Irondad

Warnings: um saddness, crying

Not good not good not good!

Peter’s spider senses were making his head spin, an ongoing alarm raking his skull. He stumbled through New York, feet landing uneasily against the dirty sidewalk. Peter didn’t want to catch the attention of anyone, but it was a little difficult when Spiderman was running down the sidewalk. 

This is wrong, it’s wrong!

“Shh, shh.” Peter tries to quiet the pounding in his head. He knows that this world isn’t his, why was his brain acting like he didn’t? “It’s okay, it’s okay.” 

He can hardly focus on where he’s walking, eyes glued to those five letters plastered to a sky scraper up ahead. 

Get help get help!

He stumbles past more civilians, two teenagers walking together while holding hands. They watch as he skitters past, holding onto the wall with one hand. 

“Oh, he needs some dairy!” One of them quips, making the other laugh. 

Peter’s head spins, this time for a different reason, “Well that’s just not right.” 

Go go go go

But Peter doesn’t want to listen. He’s trapped in another dimension and no one knows who he is - not really. Even if he goes, and even if he see’s him, it won’t be him. Why make it harder on himself than his griefs already been? 

Tony.

He can’t help it. Anything to see him again. His eyes water inside the mask at the mere thought of it. With a new sense of purpose, most of his coordination is back, and Peter is swinging desperately through the skies. 

Down below, everything is still wrong. The world is just like his, but not quite. Phrases are similar but not the same, shops that have closed down were still running strong. 

Find him find him

Peter is scaling the tower now, scanning through every floor for a glimpse of him. When Peter gets a glimpse inside the lab, he wants to sob. He crawls over to where his usual entrance should be, but he’s unable to take his eyes off the man working inside. The glass slides and Peter drops down, ripping off his mask to just stare.  

Tony looks up to find his kid with swollen, red, watery eyes and a quivering lip. He looked like he’s cried for days, which was odd, because Tony thought he’d just seen him this morning. 

“Peter- what’s wrong?” He drops everything to get to the boy. He doesn’t have to cross the whole lab, though, because the kid is running. Running with open arms as his face contorts and he lets out an ugly sob, tears pouring from his eyes. “Hey, he-”

Peter hits him with a force that knocks the wind out of his lungs, but he wraps his arms around the kid nonetheless. Tony’s hand brushes through Peter’s curls while he clings and sobs. 

Safe.

“I missed you s-so much.” Peter cries out, breath hitching in his throat. 

That comment has Tony furrowing his eyebrows and trying to detach the kid from him, because he definitely just saw Peter this morning. It takes a moment of coaxing but eventually Peter peels himself away, making Tony realize he had literally stuck to him. Peter’s face shines with tears, and he’s practically choking on his uncontrollable sobs. 

“Whoa, hey, what’s going on?” Tony asks, gently trying to brush away Peter’s tears. “You missed me? I saw you this morning. What’s really going on?”

Stupid. Stupid. 

The knowledge that there was another version of himself in this world, even though he should have assumed that, made him want to cry more. This Tony had another Peter. Why did he have to draw the short straw?

“I-I..” The thought of explaining the multiverse situation seemed draining to Peter, who couldn’t stop crying. Why couldn’t he stop crying? “I’ll explain it. Just- please.” 

Peter wrapped himself around Tony again, who let him do as he pleased. The kid was obviously extremely shaken up about something. Something that had to do with him. 

“Okay, okay.” Tony tries to shush Peter’s sobs, which were now dying down to hiccups. He holds Peter with both arms, chin resting upon his head, and rocks them back and forth. “I missed you too.” 

Peter sighed. If only he knew.

Not good not good not good!

Peter’s spider senses were making his head spin, an ongoing alarm raking his skull. He stumbled through New York, feet landing uneasily against the dirty sidewalk. Peter didn’t want to catch the attention of anyone, but it was a little difficult when Spiderman was running down the sidewalk. 

This is wrong, it’s wrong!

“Shh, shh.” Peter tries to quiet the pounding in his head. He knows that this world isn’t his, why was his brain acting like he didn’t? “It’s okay, it’s okay.” 

He can hardly focus on where he’s walking, eyes glued to those five letters plastered to a sky scraper up ahead. 

Get help get help!

[[MORE]]

He stumbles past more civilians, two teenagers walking together while holding hands. They watch as he skitters past, holding onto the wall with one hand. 

“Oh, he needs some dairy!” One of them quips, making the other laugh. 

Peter’s head spins, this time for a different reason, “Well that’s just not right.” 

Go go go go

But Peter doesn’t want to listen. He’s trapped in another dimension and no one knows who he is - not really. Even if he goes, and even if he see’s him, it won’t be him. Why make it harder on himself than his griefs already been? 

Tony.

He can’t help it. Anything to see him again. His eyes water inside the mask at the mere thought of it. With a new sense of purpose, most of his coordination is back, and Peter is swinging desperately through the skies. 

Down below, everything is still wrong. The world is just like his, but not quite. Phrases are similar but not the same, shops that have closed down were still running strong. 

Find him find him

Peter is scaling the tower now, scanning through every floor for a glimpse of him. When Peter gets a glimpse inside the lab, he wants to sob. He crawls over to where his usual entrance should be, but he’s unable to take his eyes off the man working inside. The glass slides and Peter drops down, ripping off his mask to just stare.  

Tony looks up to find his kid with swollen, red, watery eyes and a quivering lip. He looked like he’s cried for days, which was odd, because Tony thought he’d just seen him this morning. 

“Peter- what’s wrong?” He drops everything to get to the boy. He doesn’t have to cross the whole lab, though, because the kid is running. Running with open arms as his face contorts and he lets out an ugly sob, tears pouring from his eyes. “Hey, he-”

Peter hits him with a force that knocks the wind out of his lungs, but he wraps his arms around the kid nonetheless. Tony’s hand brushes through Peter’s curls while he clings and sobs. 

Safe.

“I missed you s-so much.” Peter cries out, breath hitching in his throat. 

That comment has Tony furrowing his eyebrows and trying to detach the kid from him, because he definitely just saw Peter this morning. It takes a moment of coaxing but eventually Peter peels himself away, making Tony realize he had literally stuck to him. Peter’s face shines with tears, and he’s practically choking on his uncontrollable sobs. 

“Whoa, hey, what’s going on?” Tony asks, gently trying to brush away Peter’s tears. “You missed me? I saw you this morning. What’s really going on?”

Stupid. Stupid. 

The knowledge that there was another version of himself in this world, even though he should have assumed that, made him want to cry more. This Tony had another Peter. Why did he have to draw the short straw?

“I-I..” The thought of explaining the multiverse situation seemed draining to Peter, who couldn’t stop crying. Why couldn’t he stop crying? “I’ll explain it. Just- please.” 

Peter wrapped himself around Tony again, who let him do as he pleased. The kid was obviously extremely shaken up about something. Something that had to do with him. 

“Okay, okay.” Tony tries to shush Peter’s sobs, which were now dying down to hiccups. He holds Peter with both arms, chin resting upon his head, and rocks them back and forth. “I missed you too.” 

Peter sighed. If only he knew.

blog.name: thelastnerd
blog.title: bloody hell
blog.description: the one who supposed to work but only geeks

summary: Hi, everyone. Not sure if anybody's gonna read it but I wanted so say thank you. Tony Stark was a bigger part of my life than...
body: Hi, everyone. Not sure if anybody’s gonna read it but I wanted so say thank you. Tony Stark was a bigger part of my life than many people I knew for real, he had bones in my reality for years. I felt that pain when that thing happened and I’m still feeling but it’s a hard thing to explain to my real world. My family and my friends understanding me but only till a point. But here in Tumblr, I read so many crazy things about love we have for Tony Stark and… You now… Thank you.

reblog.comment: Hi, everyone. Not sure if anybody’s gonna read it but I wanted so say thank you. But here in Tumblr, I read so many crazy things about love we have for Tony Stark and… You now… Thank you.

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

summary: The Prince's Bride
title: The Prince's Bride
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Wttpoa

by MarvelousMenagerie (HiddenOne)

After Tony loses the love of his life to pirates on the high sea, not much matters to him. He agrees to wed Prince Justin Hammer to gain access to vibranium and shut himself away in his workshop until the end of time, but a group of ruffians kidnap Tony to take him to Hydra.

Tony’s rescue takes on an unlikely form - the Dread Pirate Rogers, who killed the love of his life five years ago.

A Princess Bride AU

Words: 8647, Chapters: 4/4, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Marvel
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: James “Bucky” Barnes, Tony Stark, Justin Hammer, Thor (Marvel), Hulk (Marvel), Obadiah Stane
  • Relationships: James “Bucky” Barnes/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Princess Bride Fusion, The Princess Bride References, Alternate Universe - Medieval, Humor, Canon-Typical Violence, Not Really Character Death


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Wttpoa

tags: im watching their academy conference thing
summary: The fact that Feige said that never, in the 2 years of shooting and waiting for endgame to release, did they call the funeral...
body: The fact that Feige said that never, in the 2 years of shooting and waiting for endgame to release, did they call the funeral scene, “the funeral scene.” Since the very beginning it was referred to as “The Wedding” and they had the entire cast, everyone, not just who we actually got to see in that scene, but everyone was there in front of the cabin.

reblog.comment: The fact that Feige said that never, in the 2 years of shooting and waiting for endgame to release, did they call the funeral scene, “the funeral scene.” Since the very beginning it was referred to as “The Wedding” and they had the entire cast, everyone, not just who we actually got to see in that scene, but everyone was there in front of the cabin.

trail.content_raw: The fact that Feige said that never, in the 2 years of shooting and waiting for endgame to release, did they call the funeral scene, “the funeral scene.” Since the very beginning it was referred to as “The Wedding” and they had the entire cast, everyone, not just who we actually got to see in that scene, but everyone was there in front of the cabin.
trail.content: The fact that Feige said that never, in the 2 years of shooting and waiting for endgame to release, did they call the funeral scene, “the funeral scene.” Since the very beginning it was referred to as “The Wedding” and they had the entire cast, everyone, not just who we actually got to see in that scene, but everyone was there in front of the cabin.

blog.name: spider-momo
blog.title: love you 3000
blog.description: lil bit of everything here

summary: give me a remedy - amomo - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]
title: give me a remedy - amomo - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Tony died.

And then he came back.

Except it’s been five years and Steve’s old now, and Peter grew up, Morgan hardly recognizes him, and everything is different and Tony hates it, hates not feeling okay. And he’s not okay, far from it.

But he’s gotta keep going, right?

reblog.comment:

Except it’s been five years and Steve’s old now, and Peter grew up, Morgan hardly recognizes him, and everything is different and Tony hates it, hates not feeling okay. And he’s not okay, far from it.

But he’s gotta keep going, right?

But he’s gotta keep going, right?
